intro: Terminalia phanerophlebia, commonly known as the African sand apple, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and elongated, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by edible, spherical fruits that are yellow when ripe. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Terminalia phanerophlebia plays an important ecological role in supporting local wildlife and is valued for its timber and fruit.
